Kindly quote this unique reference number in every transaction pertaining this offer on house .

Accepting and returning this offer letter within one week from the offer date with the evidence of payment of a total deposit of ₦ into the accounts of brains and hammers limited.

Notwithstanding the provisions of Clauses 1, 2 and 3, of this agreement regulating the terms of payment for the housing unit provisionally allocated to the Allotee both the Vendor and Allotee agree that the commencement date which is the date for the commencement of construction works of the Allotee’s housing unit shall be the date as communicated by the Vendor to the allotee and where there is a variation of such commencement date then it shall be any further date as communicated by the Vendor to the Allotee.

Notwithstanding the provisions of Clauses 1, 2 and 3, of this agreement regulating the terms of payment for the housing unit provisionally allocated to the Allotee both the Vendor and Allotee agree that the duration construction time of this agreement shall be such period as communicated by the Vendor to the Allotee and where there is a variation of the duration construction time any further date as communicated by the Vendor to the Allotee

Notwithstanding the provisions of Clauses 1, 2 and 3, of this agreement regulating the terms of payment for the housing unit provisionally allocated to the Allotee both the Vendor and Allotee agree that the completion date shall the date as communicated by the Vendor to the Allotee and where there is a variation and or extension of the completion time as communicated by the Vendor any further date as communicated by the Vendor to the Allotee.

Each Allotee shall in making any of the stage payment to the Vendor’s account or any payment with respect to any housing unit allotted to them include in their deposit slips their name(s) and if a corporate entity their corporate name along with the provisional house number, reference number and the specific housing estate of the housing unit they are paying for.

This allocation letter is provisional and only upon the Allotee fulfilling the terms and conditions contained herein shall the Allotee shall be issued by the Vendor with a Final letter of allocation and thereafter the Deed of sale Agreement.
The Provisional letter of allocation is not title to the housing unit and cannot be used by any Allotee to sell, assign, transfer any interest to a third party in respect of any housing unit(s).

Each Allotee shall where they have given instructions to any agent or representative to make any of the stage payments on their behalf shall ensure compliance by any such agent or representative with the terms of this agreement.

Where any Allotee has made any stage payment in furtherance to the terms of this provisional agreement such an Allotee shall not in any circumstances whatsoever be entitled to a refund of such deposits made pursuant to this agreement save for where the provisional allocation is revoked by the vendor for failure by the Allotee to make any of the stage payments as and when due under this agreement; provided as always that the Vendor shall refund to the Allotee the deposit made for the housing unit less ten percent (10%) of the full purchase price deducted by the Vendor as administrative fees upon the purchase and full payment for the said housing unit by a subsequent Allotee.

By the terms of this provisional letter of allocation the Vendor holds itself out as possessing the requisite technical and professional skill and competence to execute the terms of this agreement while the Allotee holds itself out as having the immediate source of funds to pay for the execution of the terms of this agreement as such no Allotee shall determine this agreement on the basis that it does not have a sufficiency of funds to pay or continue to pay for the commencement, continuation and completion of the execution of the terms of this agreement or make the stage payments as agreed by the Vendor and the Allotee under this Agreement.

The Vendor shall be under obligation to deliver on the terms and conditions of this agreement to wit the delivery of the housing unit(s) due for which payment has been made by the Allotee under the terms of this agreement and shall not be under any obligation whatsoever for the refund of monies paid for the commencement, continuance and completion of the housing unit due under the terms of this agreement (save for as provided for in this agreement) and both the Vendor and the Allotee further agree that the Vendor’s obligation to the Allotee under the terms of this agreement shall only be with respect to the delivery of any such housing unit(s) as agreed under the terms of this agreement and that the Allotee shall not be entitled to any monetary refund at any stage of the execution of works with respect to the housing unit(s) except as under such circumstance as stated in this agreement.

Every Allotee shall bear the cost of processing their individual certificate of occupancy in respect of the individual housing unit at a price to be determined by the department of Mass Housing office, Federal Capital Territory, Abuja or such other Statutory authorities vested with such duties at the completion of the whole estate which cost shall be communicated to each Allotee by the department of Mass Hosing through the Vendor at the completion of their housing unit.

The Vendor shall initially issue a Final letter of allocation and a Deed of Sublease to each Allotee after( on such a date as agreed and communicated by the Vendor to the Allotee) the completion of the housing units types by the Vendor and shall also procure for the Allotee the statutory forms (at the fee charged for such forms by statutory authorities) required for the processing by each Allotee of its individual Certificate of Occupancy from the department of Mass housing but all matters connected with statutory payments to be made to the department of Mass housing with respect to the issuance of the individual Certificate of Occupancy by the department of Mass housing to the individual Allotee shall be as between the Allotee and the Department of Mass Housing Federal Capital Territory, Abuja( this is for city and mass housing estates ).
The cost of perfection of the title shall be borne by the Allotee.

Documentation and Legal Fee: The Allotee shall pay 1% of the value of the purchased property as documentation and Legal fees. Payment shall be by bankers’ cheque or draft in the name of Adeoba Ademoyega and Co. which shall be made at the payment of the third instalment.

The Allotee shall be given possession of the property upon full payment of the aforementioned purchase price as well as the legal fees, service charges, infrastructure leasing charges, generator meter, AEDC meter, water meter, water pumps at the housing units and automatic change over switch, waste bin, as well as other impositions herein-contained and all allocations are provisional until all payments have been received by the Vendor. The Facility Management Office within the City will communicate the prices to the Allotee(s).

The Vendor shall directly or through its nominated agents undertake the provision of the Facility Management Services within the City including but not limited to the following; provision of security personnel, provision of external cleaners, generator servicing, external electrical equipment servicing, gardening, cleaning and horticulture works, fumigation, plumbing works, regular servicing of fire-fighting equipment, management and disposal of waste disposal units, keeping of the common grounds, pavements, street lightings, roads and other facilities and the cost of all such services shall be subject to periodic review from time to time as determined by the Vendor.

The Capital Charge is now to be referred to as the Infrastructural Leasing Charge and any prior reference to the term capital charge shall mean infrastructure leasing charge with regard to any prior documentation issued by the Vendor to any Allotee.

The cost of leasing and maintaining ( that is maintenance based on wear and tear and not as occasioned by negligence of any residence of the City) by the Allotees of infrastructural facilities provided and owned by the Vendor within the City such as transformers, ring main units, the perimeter fence, entry gates, the boreholes, water pumping machines (both surface and submersible) road reconstruction, reconstruction of drainages, culverts, purchase and replacement of damaged or destroyed street lights, replacement of armoured cables, replacement of the electric fence, replacement of water reservoir tank(s)purchase of new feeder pillars, replacement of low voltage panels, replacement of high voltage panels, reconstruction of security house, replacement of Abuja Electrical Distribution Company (AEDC) skipper or maximum demand meters, water treatment plant(s), central storage bins, diesel storage tank(s), lightening protection system(s), synchronizing panels, street signage(s) and closed circuit security systems (CCTV) shall be borne by all Allotees by the payment of an infrastructure leasing charge annually in the amount as provided for in the Final letter of allocation.
The Service charge shall be paid in advance by each Allotee and the amount shall be as provided for in the final allocation letter to be issued by the Vendor to each Allotee.
The Service charge shall be subject to periodic review from time to time as determined by the Vendor.
The Infrastructure leasing charge shall be paid in advance by each Allotee and the amount shall be as provided for in the Final allocation letter to be issued by the Vendor to each Allotee.
The Infrastructure leasing charge shall be subject to periodic review from time to time as determined by the Vendor.
The Service charge and the Infrastructure leasing charge must be paid along with the purchase price of the allotted unit and every year thereafter.

The Service charge and the Infrastructure leasing charge shall be paid at the same time by the Allotee to the account designated by the Vendor or to the Vendor’s authorised representative and each Allotee must state in their payment slips the number of their housing unit and the specific Estate within the City they have been allotted a housing unit.

Failure to effect payment of the Service charge and the Infrastructure leasing charge shall result in the withdrawal of common facility services from the defaulting Allotee for the period of the default; this is without prejudice to any other action that the Vendor may take to against the Allotee.

Each Allotee shall pay the ground rent, tenement rates, taxes, assessments, impositions, duties, levies and other outgoings of an annual, statutory and recurrent nature which are now and may be charged, levied, assessed or imposed upon the premises by the Federal Capital Territory or the local government authorities during the term to be created or any such terms as contained in its Final letter of allocation, Deed of Sublease agreement and any increment in respect of any such charges.

The Allotee shall pay Value Added Tax (VAT) being 5% of the purchase price of the property (payable by Bank draft in the name of Brains and Hammers Limited) which tax shall be net of the purchase price and must be paid before the Allotee is handed over their housing unit.

The property is offered in the condition and state it is and on taking possession the Allotee must expressly accept that the vendor is under no obligation to you except for such fittings and fixtures that the company has specifically covenanted to provide in the property and in particular the vendor shall not be responsible for the provision of kitchenette, , wardrobes, water heaters, air-conditioning units, burglary proofs, external water storage tanks, water metres, water pumps, electrical metres, Picket fence, car port in any of the housing units; the Vendor shall also not lay interlocking blocks or tiles or cement work at the backyard of the housing unit.
The property shall be used for residential purposes only.
The keeping of pets and or domestic animals is expressly prohibited.
Satellite dishes and external communication equipment and devices shall be erected at designated areas as directed by the Vendor.
That no alteration, modification, addition will be made on the allotted unit without the approval of the Vendor.

The Allotee shall utilise the services of the Vendor’s electricians and plumbers resident in the City in the course of repair or replacement of plumbing or electrical appliances in their respective allotted units to prevent damage of the common electrical and plumbing devices.

The Allotee shall be at liberty to install alternative power generating devices in its allotted unit such as solar panels, inverters (whether electrical or manual) provided that the Allotee shall not install a generator in any housing unit whether electrical or mechanical

The Vendor is to provide generators or other source of power within the City for the supply of electricity to the Allotee(s) where there is no supply of electricity by the Abuja Electrical Distribution Company (AEDC).

Payment for electricity supply within the City by means of generators or other alternative source of power provided by the Vendor shall be by prepaid token purchased by each Allotee from the office of Facility Manager in the City.

Each Allotee shall purchase directly from the Abuja Electricity Distribution Company (AEDC) for its electricity consumption and billing an electric meter for their individual housing unit and shall pay directly for electricity usage by such means as agreed with the AEDC.

The prepaid token purchased from the office of the Facility Management office within the City is to cater for only electricity supplied by the Vendor through the installed generators or alternative generating sources.
The Vendor is to provide within the City High End Transformers, HT and LV Panels or other source of power generating appliances for the smooth running of electricity services within the City.

All Allotees are to procure from the Facility Management office within the City an individual check meter for their housing unit; This is compulsory for each housing unit, these individual housing unit check metre is to regulate the energy consumption of each housing unit and upon purchase of the individual housing unit check metre it becomes the property of Allotee and each occupant is responsible for its replacement upon same becoming defective.

The Electricity tariff structure instituted by the Vendor for the City is for the proper function of the installed generators or other source of power which structure is based on the aggregation of the City energy requirement where there is no provision of electricity to the City by the Abuja Electrical Distribution Company (AEDC).

The City Electricity tariff which is compulsory for all Allotees also captures the diesel consumption requirements of the City and maintenance of the generators provided that and it is hereby agreed by the Allotee that the City rate shall be subject to review from time to time by the Vendor.

The Vendor shall maintain within the City a Twenty Four (24) hour Seven days a week uninterrupted electricity supply regime by an integration of both electricity supply by the Abuja Electricity Distribution Company(AEDC) with the installed generators or other source of power within the City provided that every Allotee who purchases a housing unit in the City by this agreement also subscribes to the Twenty four (24) hours Seven days a week uninterrupted electricity supply regime and hereby covenants not to directly or indirectly subvert the Twenty Four (24) hour seven days a week uninterrupted electricity supply regime.

The Vendor shall continue to reserve the right to revoke the provisional allocation of any Allotee where the activities of any such Allotee is inimical to the Vendor achieving the Twenty four (24) hours seven days a week uninterrupted electricity supply regime within the City or where such Allotee engages in any activity of a criminal nature which is punishable under the laws of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

The Vendor reserves the right to revoke the provisional allocation of any Allotee where such Allotee instigates the institution of civil or criminal proceedings against the Vendor or its agents or where such Allotee(s) agitates for the civil disturbance within the City or disturbs the peace of the office of the Vendor and or the Facility Management office within the City.

The Vendor reserves the right to revoke the provisional allocation of any Allotee where such an Allotee’s action or inaction in the opinion of the Vendor amounts to a material breach of the terms of this agreement provided as always and it is hereby agreed by the Vendor and the Allotee that under the circumstances stated in this agreement the Vendor shall issue a revocation notice to any such Allotee whether in occupation of the allotted housing unit or not and thereafter issue the said Allotee a bank draft in the sum equal to the Allotee’s purchase price( less the 10% deducted by the Vendor as administrative fees of the housing unit) in such circumstances any such Allotee shall have one month or such period as granted by the Vendor to move out of the City after which period it shall be deemed a trespasser in the City and liable to be evicted through lawful means from the housing unit.

The provision of portable water in the City by the Federal Capital Territory water board shall be complemented by the Vendor providing boreholes within the City and the payment for the provision of water to each housing unit shall be by a pre-paid payment system.
The pre-paid water metres for each housing unit shall be paid for by each Allotee before the date of hand over of each housing unit to each allotee, which payment shall be made to the Vendor.

The Vendor shall operate a prepaid water payment system in each housing unit and each Allotee shall pay for water supply to their respective housing unit by the purchase of prepaid token from the office of the Facility Management office within the City.

The prepaid token for the prepaid water metres for each housing unit purchased from the Facility Management office within the City shall cover the cost of water supply by both the Water Board Authority as well as water supplied by the boreholes into the City by the Vendor.

The use of external electricians, plumbers or other artisans is expressly prohibited in the City save for carpenters and satellite dish technicians to prevent damage of the central electrical and plumbing devices within the Estate.
There shall be routine stop and searches conducted on persons going out and coming into the City.
For free flow of vehicular and human traffic within the City, double parking, parking on the streets, embankments, pavements and adjourning pavements within the City are hereby expressly prohibited.

The number of domestic and or household staff of each allotted housing unit shall be forwarded by each Allotee to the Facility Management office within the City for the purpose of easy identification of persons residing on the City.

Domestic staff of each housing unit shall be issued with identification cards by the Vendor or Allotee (or as the parties may further agree) for easy identification while each Allotee is enjoined to notify the Facility Management office within the City of the termination of the employment of any domestic staff and retrieve such identification cards issued to any such of its staff.

The Allotee bears a vicarious liability for any act of misdemeanour of any person(s) residing in their housing unit where the terms of this agreement are not complied with by the Allotee within a reasonable time.
That in accordance with the statutorily approved building plans no Allotee shall erect any fence on its allotted unit.
The dredging or drilling of boreholes on allotted units is prohibited.
The erection of security house on each allotted unit is prohibited.
The Allotee hereby covenants that it shall make all payments as stated in this provisional letter of allocation as and when due under this offer.

The Allotee shall not defer the commencement date for computation of Service charges and Infrastructure leasing charges in respect of their allotted housing unit whether or not the allotted housing unit is occupied and whether or not the Allotee or its tenants intends to reside in their housing unit or not.

No Allotee shall refuse to pay to the Vendor or the Facility Management office within the City Service charge and Infrastructure leasing charge and other charges listed in this agreement due in respect of their allotted housing unit where such allotted housing unit is ready for hand over to the allotee on the ground that such allotee does not desire to reside in the said allotted unit or desires to put up same for sale, lease or let to third parties.
The Vendor hereby warranties that the housing units constructed shall be fit for habitation by the Allotees.
The Vendor and the Allotee agree that Facility Management office within the City shall manage the Estates within the City as representatives of the Vendor

Upon the completion of the housing unit the Allotee shall be written( by delivered letters or e-mail) or communicated with by telephone by the Vendor and or Facility Management office within the City informing the Allotee of the completion of the housing unit and a date agreed to by both the Facility Management office within the City and the Allotee for the inspection of the housing unit by the Allotee and the Facility Management office within the City and on the agreed date the Allotee shall carry out the said inspection with the Facility Management office personnel designated for such purpose and upon the completion of the inspection the Facility Management office within the City shall check in the Allotee and handed over possession of the housing unit to the Allotee.
The Estate Facility Management office personnel and the Allotee shall jointly sign off on the Check- in Form(s) before handing over of the housing unit to the Allotee.

No Allotee shall be allowed entry into, gain access to or enter into physical possession of any housing unit in the City without going through the inspection, Checking -in and handing over process with the Facility Management Office within the City and where any Allotee has contravened this clause such Allotee shall be deemed to be in material breach of the terms of this agreement and will be ejected by the Facility Management office within the City from the housing unit until such a date as decided by the Facility Management office within the City and such date communicated to the said Allotee and the Inspection, Checking- in and handover process is carried out as between the Estate Facility Management office within the City and the Allotee.
The Allotee shall assume legal liability for running and maintaining its allotted housing unit once the housing unit has been handed over to the Allotee by the City Facility Management office.
The Inspection, Check- in and Hand Over process of the housing unit shall be as between the City Facility Management office within the Estate and the Allotee only.

Where the Vendor has written the Allotee of any housing unit informing such Allotee of the completion of the housing unit and requesting to hand over to the Allotee the said allotted housing unit and has requested the payment of the service charge, infrastructure leasing charge and legal fee in respect of such housing unit from the Allotee and such Allotee refuses, neglects or fails to pay for the said service charges, infrastructural leasing charges and legal fees and these monies remain unremitted and unpaid for a period of Three(3) months after the said letter, the Vendor reserves the right to rescind the sale to the Allotee and revoke the allocation.

Where any housing unit is revoked by the Vendor subject to the preceding clause the Vendor shall refund the deposit paid by the former Allotee of any such housing unit less Ten percent (10%) of the deposit deducted by the Vendor as administrative fees when a buyer has been found by the Vendor and the said buyer has made full payment for the housing unit.

Where any of the Allotee’s stage payment(s) has become due under clauses under the terms of this provisional offer and the Allotee has refused, neglected or failed to make the said stage payment(s) to the Vendor, the Vendor shall at its sole discretion amend the terms and conditions of the provisional letter of allocation to extend the completion date by a minimum extension period of six(6) months or such further or lesser period as shall be determined by the Vendor and communicated to the Allotee; The Allotee hereby covenants by the terms of this agreement to accept the extension of the completion date of its housing unit.

Where an Allotee’s stage payment become due under the terms of this agreement and the Allotee has consistently and continuously defaulted in making the stage payments as and when due the Vendor shall in its sole discretion relocate the Allotee from that phase of housing unit development within the City to the next phase of housing unit development within the City being carried on by the Vendor and shall promptly notify the Allotee of their relocation; The Allotee hereby covenants by the terms of this agreement to accept its relocation to the next phase of housing unit development within the City by the Vendor.

Where an Allotee’s stage payment become due under the terms of this agreement and the Allotee has consistently and continuously defaulted in making the stage payments as and when due the Vendor shall in its sole discretion relocate the Allotee from that phase of housing unit development within the Estate to the next phase of housing unit development within the Estate being carried on by the Vendor and shall promptly notify the Allotee of their relocation; The Allotee hereby covenants by the terms of this agreement to accept its relocation to the next phase of housing unit development within the Estate by the Vendor.

Where for reason of provision of additional infrastructure or realignment of structure in further compliance with regulatory authorities or acts required for the benefit or best interest of the estate or majority of allotee(s) and or the vendor, housing unit(s) subscribed to are required to be moved, changed , reallocated or relocated from initially and mutually agreed position, then such shall be done by duly informing the affected allotee prior(who shall not with its consent unreasonably) and the vendor shall fully ensure that the said change is totally commensurate with unit earlier purchase at previous agreed location.A

All allocations of housing units and housing unit numbers within the City are provisional until all payments as contained in the provisional letter of allocation and Final letter of allocation are made by the Allotee.

All allocations of housing unit(s) within the City are provisional and until all housing units are completed, inspected, the Allotee Checked- in and handed over the housing unit by the City Facility Management office to the Allotee; the Vendor reserves the right at all times to re-allocate any housing unit where any such housing unit is yet to be completed, inspected, and handed over by the City Facility Management office personnel to any Allotee provided that and it is hereby covenanted by the Vendor that in any such circumstance provision will be made for any Allotee affected by any such re-allocation by the Vendor such Allotee being allocated a housing unit of the same type in form and specification.

Both the Vendor and Allotee agree that no right of action against the Vendor exists or is maintainable by any Allotee against the Vendor for any re-allocation of housing units by the Vendor in the City as no Allotee has any proprietary or ownership rights over any housing unit until the City Facility Management office notifies the Allotee in writing and a date is agreed as between the City Facility Management Office and the Allotee for a joint inspection of the housing unit, Checking- in of the Allotee and hand over of the housing unit to the Allotee by the Facility Management office within the City.

The Allotee shall obtain all information relating to Sales, Vendor construction sites, general information, allocations, updates on construction matters and vendor’s products from the Vendor’s customers service department.

No Allotee shall transfer, donate by way of a Power of Attorney, sell, assign, convey or otherwise deal with any housing unit allotted to it until any such Allotee has completed payment of all fees due (which fees include the payment of the cost price, service charges, infrastructure leasing charges and legal fees) in respect of the said housing unit.

No Allotee has or shall exercise right of title over any housing unit or proprietary rights over any housing unit provisionally allotted to it until all payments as contained in their provisional letter of allocation and Final letter of allocation have been made to the Vendor and or the Facility Management office within the City as are required.

Where any Allotee who having failed to complete payment for any housing unit allotted to them and without notice and approval of the Vendor purports to transfer, sell, assign, convey or otherwise deal with any such housing unit with any third party, such an Allotee shall have their provisional offer revoked immediately by the Vendor and shall be refunded their deposit less Ten (10%) of their deposit for any such housing unit which shall be deducted as administrative fees.

An Allotee who having satisfied all the terms and conditions of sale including the payment to the Vendor of the full purchase price, service charges, infrastructure leasing charges and legal fees and all the fees as stated in this agreement, shall where desirous of effecting a transfer, conveyance, sale, assignment of any such housing unit to a third party, inform the Vendor in writing upon which the Vendor shall prepare an offer letter, Final letter of allocation and a Deed of Sublease Agreement in the name of the new allotee.
Further to the terms of this agreement, the subsisting agreement shall be the Deed of Sublease as between the Vendor and the new Allotee.
Further to the terms of this agreement, the preceding sale agreement and Deed of Sublease as between the Vendor and the preceding Allotee shall be voided and kept in the custody of the Vendor.

Further to the foregoing clauses both the preceding Allotee and the new Allotee of the housing unit to be assigned, conveyed, transferred or sold shall provide documentary evidence to the Vendor evidencing the transaction between them; which evidence shall include Deed of Sale and evidence of payment for the housing unit. The Vendor shall keep a copy of the aforementioned documents.
The preceding Allotee shall take out an indemnity agreement in favour of the Vendor in the amount contained in the new sale agreement between the Vendor and the new Allotee.

Where an allotee wishes to change his or her name in respect of the title document he or she acquires or will acquire as a result of purchasing any unit from bungalow city, such an allotte shall bear the cost of said change being 1% of the offer price of the unit payable in the name of Abubakar Sheidu and Co which payment must be in Bank draft

The new sale agreement as between the Vendor and the new Allotee shall be subject to a one percent (2%) resale fee charge payable in an account as shell be communicated by the Vendor which payment must be in Bank draft.

The Vendor shall not be liable to the Allotee for any delay in completing, commissioning and delivering the allotted housing units on the agreed date of completion if such delay is due to Force Majeure. For the purposes of this offer “FORCE MAJEURE” shall mean any act, event, or condition beyond reasonable control and without the fault or negligence of the Vendor and or its agents including; acts of God, war, sabotage, riot, insurrection, civil commotion, political impasse, national emergency, weather cyclone, earthquake, landslide and explosion or such like acts).

The Performance of the terms of this offer shall be suspended for the duration of the disability resulting from the Force Majeure and neither the Vendor nor the Allotee shall be liable for delay or failure in the performance of any of the terms and conditions of this offer for such duration, provided that the Vendor shall promptly give notice of the occurrence of such Force Majeure to the Allotee and agree with the Allotee as to the time, which the Vendor shall, after the cessation of the Force Majeure, discharge its obligations under this agreement.

The Vendor warranties that all materials to be used for the construction of the housing units within the City shall be of good quality and all the personnel to be engaged for the execution of the works shall be sufficiently skilled and competent and further warrants that the roofing and structures shall be without defects, which may be due to the quality of materials used or the competence of the workers engaged, for a period of six (6) months after completion of the housing unit.

Where the Vendor is unable to complete and deliver the housing unit by the completion date it shall give notice to the Allotee and shall give the Allotee a specific time within which it shall complete and handover the housing unit to the Allotee.

The completion date refers to the date for the completion of the construction of the housing unit of the Allotee and does not include the completion of construction works on the commercial areas, green areas and other facilities within the Estate.

No Allotee who has been handed over their housing unit and is a resident in the City shall hold the Vendor liable for any continuing or on -going development or construction work in the Estate or the noise level any such on -going development construction work in the City.

Further to provisions of this offer the Vendor reserves the right to revoke any allotted unit:-
Where the payment terms are not strictly adhered to
Where the Allotee consistently refuses to make stage payments as and when due.
Where the Allotee refuses, neglects or fails to make stage payments as at when due despite repeated demands via letters or telephone, fax or email correspondence.
Where the failure of any Allotee to make timely payment is in conflict with the collective interest of other Allotees and is inimical to the timely completion of the housing units.

The Provisional letter of allocation, the Final letter of allocation and the Deed of sublease agreement to be executed by the Vendor and the Allotee with regard to any housing unit purchased in the City shall be read and interpreted as one indivisible continuing agreement as between the Allotee and the Vendor and none of the aforementioned agreements shall be interpreted as independent of the other particularly with regard to the clauses dealing with the issue of ownership of infrastructural facilities in the City which title is vested in the Vendor at all times.

Where any material clause relating to the aforementioned proprietary rights of the Vendor over all infrastructural facilities in the City is inadvertently omitted in the Deed of Sublease but contained in the Provisional letter of allocation and or in the Final letter of allocation such clause(s) shall be deemed to and have the same legal effect of forming part of the clauses of the Deed of Sublease as if same were specifically stated in the Deed of Sublease agreement executed by the Vendor and the Allotee.

Where any clause is contained in the Provisional letter of allocation, Final letter of allocation or the Deed of Sublease which purports to confer any proprietary right over any of the infrastructural facilities in the City on the Allotee(s) both the Vendor and the Allotee hereby agree that any such clause shall be void.
The Allotee’s proprietary rights within the City shall be limited to the housing unit bought by each respective Allotee only.

The Vendor has ownership of and proprietary rights over all assets and infrastructure within the City (save for the housing units sold to the Allotees) which assets and infrastructure include but are not limited to the generators, transformers, Ring Main units, Boreholes, Water Pumping Machines (both surface and submersible),Reservoir Tanks, Feeder Pillars, Low and High Voltage Panels, Electric Fence, Street lights, Fire hydrants, the Security House, the Club House, Swimming Pool, the Facility Management office, Water Treatment Plants, Diesel Storage Tanks, Synchronizing Panels, the Closed circuit security systems (CCTV) within the City as well as the Commercial areas and Green areas which right has not been derogated by the sale of housing units to Allotees within the City.

The Vendor shall manage the City exclusively utilising its aforementioned assets and infrastructure for the use of all Allotees within the City provided that and it is hereby agreed by the Vendor and the Allotee(s) that the application of the infrastructural facilities and assets for the common use of all (Vendor and Allotees by the Facility Management office within the City ) hereinafter called the Exclusive Management Agreement shall not be interpreted as common ownership of the assets and Infrastructure in the City by any Allotee as ownership is vested in the Vendor.

The Exclusive management of the City by the Vendor by the City Facility Management office is a continuing binding agreement as between the Vendor and the Allotees as well as Allotees’ successors- in title, personal representatives and assigns, which agreement each Allotee hereby covenants by this agreement shall continue in force and automatically renew for successive terms of Twenty- five (25) years each.
